conclusion: Acceleration is the slope of the v-t graph.
For object B the curve is sloping downward at the start, becomes horizontal at its lowest point, and then slopes upward more and more steeply.
From t = 0 to t1 the slope (acceleration) is negative but is getting less negative (i.e. increasing).
At t = t1 the slope is zero → acceleration is zero.
From t1 to t2 the slope is positive and keeps getting steeper → acceleration is positive and increasing.
Over the entire interval 0 → t2 the acceleration of object B increases continuously: it starts negative, rises to zero at t1, and continues to rise to a positive value by t2.
